TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 290

barker_notes.barker_summary: John Austin to Hinton Curtis, November 23, 1829. Receipt for beef.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 290

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*John Austin to Hinton Curtis, November 23, 1829. Receipt for beef.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Received from *person_mentioned*Mr. Hinton Curtis*/person_mentioned* Six hundred and Thirteen pounds Beef at three Dollars pr hundred pounds—on a/c of *person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="11-23-1829">Novr 23rd 1829*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Brasoria*/location_mentioned*— *person_mentioned* John Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
